intro: Strobilanthes reticulata, commonly known as the "Khasi flame flower," is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with a fine, hairy texture, while its flowers display vibrant colors ranging from red to orange. Strobilanthes reticulata is not only ornamental but also holds cultural significance in local communities.
